snippet: A statement by China’s top leadership showed its willingness to make trade-offs to reinvigorate exports as a troubled economy risks setting off political turmoil.
abstract: China's decision to devalue its renminbi currency to give it more flexibility in global markets and stanch unrest over its economy comes with risks; sharp focus on domestic agenda weakens China's buying power overseas, but move illustrates lengths Chinese government will go to avoid political turmoil at home.

byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Michael Schuman from Beijing. Kiki Zhao and Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A statement by China’s top leadership showed its willingness to make trade-offs to reinvigorate exports as a troubled economy risks setting off political turmoil.

headline.main: China Turned to Risky Devaluation as Export Machine Stalled
headline.print_headline: China Turned to Risky Devaluation as Export Machine Stalled
